titleStmt.title: City of Louisville v. Alexander Kerner, Verdict
CWG6827

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
City Court of Louisville
Pleas held before the Hon. Jas. P. Harbeson Judge of the City Court of Louisville on the 8th day of August 1865

City of Louisville
vs
Alexander Kenner f. m. c.

The Defendant being on trial before a Jury for setting up, using and keeping a Billiard Table in the City of Louisville without being thereto duly licensed by the Mayor and City Council, the said Jury, after hearing the evidence returned into Court the following verdict in the Warrant charging the Defendant with the offense aforesaid, towit "We of the Jury find the Defendant guilty and assess his fine at One hundred dollars to the City of Louisville, and recommend him to the Clemency of the Governor

I, Phil Tomppert Jr clerk of the City Court of Louisville certify that the foregoing is a true copy of the verdict returned into the Court by the Jury in the case against Alex Kenner this 8th day of August 1865
Phil. Tomppert Jr C, C, C, L

Louisville City Ct
Comth
vs } Copy of verdict
Alex Kenner
$100,
Remit
9 Sept/65
